title: First input delay
summary: First input delay (FID) measures the time from when a user first interacts with your site (i.e. when they click a link, tap on a button, or use a custom, JavaScript-powered control) to the time when the browser is actually able to respond to that interaction.

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
